Harry Potter.description: The main protagonist; a boy who survived Voldemort's attack. (mentions: 4)

Mr. and Mrs. Dursley.description: Harry Potter's aunt and uncle; they are Muggles. (mentions: 2)

Grunnings.description: The firm where Mr. Dursley works; it makes drills. (mentions: 2)

Lily and James Potter.description: Harry's parents; they were killed by Voldemort. (mentions: 1)

Voldemort.description: The antagonist; a powerful dark wizard. (mentions: 6)

Albus Dumbledore.description: A powerful wizard; he leaves Harry with the Dursleys. (mentions: 2)

Professor McGonagall.description: A wizard; she assists Dumbledore in placing Harry with the Dursleys. (mentions: 21)

Hagrid.description: A half-giant; he brings Harry to the Dursleys. (mentions: 14)

Privet Drive.description: The street where the Dursleys live. (mentions: 8)

Kent, Yorkshire, Dundee.description: Locations where shooting stars were seen. (mentions: 0)

owl.description: Many owls were seen flying during the day. (mentions: 18)

cat.description: A tabby cat that appears to be Professor McGonagall in disguise. (mentions: 23)

motorcycle.description: A flying motorcycle used by Hagrid. (mentions: 5)

Put-Outer.description: A device used by Dumbledore to extinguish street lamps. (mentions: 2)

scar.description: Lightning bolt-shaped scar on Harry's forehead. (mentions: 2)

letter.description: A letter left with Harry by Dumbledore. (mentions: 5)

relationships.description: J.K. Rowling wrote the book about Harry Potter.
Harry Potter is the main character of Sorcerer's Stone.
Harry Potter lives with his aunt and uncle, the Dursleys.
The Dursleys live at number four, Privet Drive.
Mr. Dursley is the director of Grunnings.
Grunnings makes drills.
The Dursleys are Dudley's parents.
Lily and James Potter are Mrs. Dursley's sister and brother-in-law.
Lily and James Potter are Harry's parents.
Voldemort killed Lily and James Potter.
Voldemort attempted to kill Harry Potter.
Harry Potter has a lightning-bolt shaped scar.
Dumbledore delivers Harry to his aunt and uncle.
Dumbledore writes a letter for Harry's aunt and uncle.
Professor McGonagall was transformed into a cat.
Hagrid brings Harry to his aunt and uncle.
Hagrid uses a flying motorcycle.
Sirius Black lent Hagrid the motorcycle.
Dumbledore uses the Put-Outer to turn off street lights.
Voldemort attacked the Potters in Godric's Hollow.
Owls were seen flying in Kent, Yorkshire, and Dundee.
Dumbledore likes lemon drops.
Dumbledore's scar resembles the London Underground.
